readability_reflection: Concatenation was more readable. I actually do not recall any exposure to interpolation until this survey, so I am unsure what it means. Concatenatio, thus, was more readable. However, the notation did look more simple than Interpolation.
comprehension_debugging: I was able to debug the code snippets by process of elimination. However, I did not have much practice with interpolation. Concatenation was easy, but the former was not. Debugging was challenging yet fun because I felt I was discovering something new.
preference_rationale: Concatenation, as notationaly I require less types of elements to implement, despite needing more total elements / code required. However, I can see why some can see it as mundane and choose interpolation.
learning_curve: Requiring me to complete 16 tasks made it feel like trial and error, which was very good for my learning, as I was slowly picking up the pattern, like a machine learning model being trained.
suggestions_improvement: Concatenation is where it needs to be, interpolation could be simpler. But I am not sure what could be implemented. As such, I am fine with the way they are now, leaving people to choose which they prefer for their coding projects.
